description:
The long-awaited report from the Army about how leaders handled shooter Robert Card in the months leading up to the Lewiston, Maine mass shootings
will be released on Monday.
title: Report finds Army leadership failures leading up to Maine bowling alley mass shooting

description: NPR's Juana Summers talks with US men's marathoners Conner Mantz and Clayton Young about the challenges of the Paris marathon, and their longtime friendship on and off the running course.
title: Longtime running buddies are poised to compete in the streets of Paris

description: Illegal narcotics may be damaging marine wildlife. Sharks are swimming in drug tainted waters, ingesting cocaine according to scientists in Brazil.
title: It’s not a B movie: scientists say sharks are ingesting cocaine in drug-tainted water

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is addressing Congress Wednesday in a speech he hopes will bolster his standing. Democrats have said there will be boycotts from some members.
title: Netanyahu is addressing Congress tomorrow. Here's what to expect from Democrats

description: NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with Ralph Basham, the director of the Secret Service during the George W. Bush administration, about  Secret Service director Kimberly Cheatle's decision to resign.
title: Former Secret Service head on the agency's controversy following the rally shooting

description: Harris’s entire career is a list of jobs that nobody who looks quite like her had held before, including California’s attorney general, senator and vice president of the United States.
title: Kamala Harris has a history of breaking barriers. How might that inform her campaign?

description: In Wisconsin, Vice President Kamala Harris kicked off the first rally of her presidential campaign, since becoming the frontrunner in the race to become the Democratic nominee.
title: VP Kamala Harris kicks off first rally of presidential campaign in Wisconsin

description: Less than a week before she was set to compete in the Paris Games, the six-time Olympic medalist in dressage was suspended from competition for her actions depicted in a video from four years ago.
title: British Olympian pulls out of Paris after 'error of judgment' sparks investigation

description: Delta Air Lines is facing a federal investigation as it struggles to recover from a global software meltdown. The Atlanta-based carrier canceled hundreds of flights Tuesday for the fifth day in a row.
title: Delta is still cancelling hundreds of flights daily

description: Vice President Harris addressed a crowd of supporters in the swing state of Wisconsin on Tuesday. Harris is poised to be the next Democratic presidential nominee.
title: In an energized 1st campaign speech, Harris makes her pitch for 2024

description: NASA's budget proposal would basically axe the most powerful X-ray telescope in the world, and astronomers are scrambling to save it.
title: The fate of the most powerful X-ray telescope is in doubt

description: One of the big mysteries of the universe is how it's expanding. The phenomenon causing that expansion is known as dark energy — and recently, scientists have started to wonder if its changing.
title: Dark energy — which causes the expansion of the universe — may be changing

description: The director of the U.S. Secret Service Kimberly Cheatle has resigned, ending her 29-year career with the agency. This comes in the wake of the attempted assassination of former President Trump.
title: Secret Service director resigns after getting grilled by Congress

description: The flurry of unverified rumors, speculation, and conspiracy theories comes as people are reeling from an onslaught of high-stakes political upheaval in a matter of days.
title: A coup, fake signatures and deepfakes are the latest conspiracy theories about 2024

description: The second baby of a tree-dwelling kangaroo made its public debut this week in New York, poking its pink head head out of its mom's furry white pouch.
title: Peekaboo! A baby tree kangaroo debuts at the Bronx Zoo

description: Autocracy, Inc. author Anne Applebaum says that today’s dictators — including Putin and Xi — are working together in a global fight to dismantle democracy, and Trump is borrowing from their playbook.
title: Expert on dictators warns: Don't lose hope -- that's what they want

description: Abdul “Duke” Fakir, the last surviving original member of the beloved Motown group the Four Tops that was known for such hits as “Reach Out, I’ll Be There” and “Standing in the Shadows of Love,” has died at age 88.
title: Abdul 'Duke' Fakir, last of the original Four Tops, dies at 88

description: President Biden's re-election bid struggled to connect with young voters. Now that Vice President Kamala Harris is the likely Democratic nominee, those same voters are re-assessing their votes.
title: Biden had a problem with young voters. Can Harris overcome it?

description: Kimberly Cheatle faced 5 hours of questioning yesterday over the security lapses leading up to the attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump.
title: Secret Service director steps down following interrogation over the attempted assassination of Trump

description: Most Palestinians who've been rounded up since Oct. 7 are incarcerated without due process or contact with the outside world, Israeli human rights organizations say. Israel denies abusing detainees.
title: Palestinian detainees from Gaza say they are facing abuse in Israeli prisons

description: Rep. Jasmine Crockett (D-Texas) discusses why she supports Kamala Harris for President.
title: Rep. Jasmine Crockett on why she supports Harris for president

description: NPR's Michel Martin asks South Carolina representative James Clyburn where the Harris campaign goes from here.
title: South Carolina representative James Clyburn on what's next for Harris' campaign

description: Some Republicans are arguing that Vice President Harris' campaign will have some legal challenges when it comes to using Biden's campaign funds. And, a new dinosaur discovery uncovered in Utah.
title: Harris' campaign faces potential legal challenges. And, a new dinosaur discovery

description: A researcher shares examples of deception in the animal kingdom.
title: Here's a question for you: Do animals lie?

description: A new state program offers any family with a new baby a no-cost visit at home with a trained nurse. It’s Oregon’s response to the country’s dismal infant and maternal mortality rates.
title: Babies don’t come with instructions. But in Oregon, they now come with a nurse

description: The Republican vice presidential candidate represents a sharp break from the Republicanism of yesteryear.
title: The economic mind of JD Vance

description: President Biden had made a career of digging in and proving the doubters wrong — until he finally met a political crisis he couldn’t ride out.
title: Biden's brand was overcoming obstacles. But this one, he couldn't beat

description: Young children and pregnant women were among the victims. At least five people have been pulled alive from the mud.
title: Death toll in southern Ethiopia mudslides rises to at least 157 as search continues

description: Vice President Harris likely has a strong claim to the funds, but not all legal experts agree. Moreover, the Federal Election Commission works too slowly to make much of an impact on the race.
title: Can Harris — or any other Democrat — access Biden campaign money?

description: John McEnroe, Billie Jean King and other tennis legends discuss their legacies in a new PBS documentary series.
title: 'Gods of Tennis' explores trailblazing legends of the sport and why we remember them

description: A fossil of an armadillo-like mammal appears to bear cut marks from butchering by humans, suggesting people were living in South America at least 20,000 years ago, even earlier than once thought.
title: When did humans get to South America? This giant shelled mammal fossil may hold clues

description: Does a younger Democratic presidential candidate have the potential to energize younger voters? NPR's A Martinez talks to Santiago Mayer, the executive director of Voters of Tomorrow.
title: Democrats hope a younger presidential candidate will attract younger voters

description: Murder charges have been filed against a fired Illinois deputy sheriff who fatally shot a woman who had called 911 for help. A video tape of the shooting in Springfield was released Monday.
title: Bodycam video released of deputy fatally shooting a woman who called 911 for help

description: The U.S. ambassador to the U.N. announces additional aid to Haiti on a lightning visit to the troubled Caribbean island.
title: U.S.  ambassador Linda Thomas-Greenfield announces $60 million in aid to Haiti

description: The U.N. High Commissioner for Refugees has pledged $100 million of support for people in Ukraine as they prepare for winter.
title: The head of the UNHCR says it's time to think about the future of Ukrainian refugees

description: Vice President Harris paid tribute to President Biden, then went to campaign headquarters to rally staff on Day 1 of her push to cement her place at the top of the Democratic ticket.
title: The Democratic Party has quickly united behind Kamala Harris' bid for the presidency

description: Republican vice presidential nominee JD Vance held a rally in Middletown, his hometown, as the party tries to pivot from a campaign tailored to take on President Biden, who dropped out of the race.
title: JD Vance returned to Ohio to kick off next phase of GOP presidential campaign

description: NPR's Michel Martin talks to Washington, D.C., Mayor Muriel Bowser about why she is part of a group of women supporting Vice President Kamala Harris for the presidential nomination.
title: Tens of thousands of Black women mobilize to support Kamala Harris

description: In Canada, melting sea ice is forcing polar bears closer and closer to human populations, so scientists there are working on a program to track polar bears, tag them with GPS units and monitor their movement.
title: Scientists are tracking polar bears to keep them -- and people safe

description: The Secret Service director was on Capitol Hill Monday. For nearly five hours, she faced questions from House lawmakers demanding answers about the attempted assassination of former President Trump.
title: Kimberly Cheatle faced House lawmakers about security lapses by Secret Service

description: Alsu Kurmasheva, a journalist for the U.S. government-funded Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty, was convicted of "spreading false information" about the Russian army.
title: Russian-American journalist sentenced to 6.5 years in rapid, secret trial

description: The ruling means Christopher Dunn is likely to be freed from prison, but no date has been set.
title: Missouri judge overturns murder conviction of man imprisoned for over 30 years

description: The vice president is poised to be her party's nominee, according to an Associated Press delegate tally. The Democratic Party swiftly coalesced around her after President Biden gave his endorsement.
title: Harris has delegate support for the nomination as DNC moves forward with virtual vote
